title: Ticket #533: DAGMan should ignore -usedagdir when running a rescue DAG
description: At least when automatically running a "new-style" rescue DAG, DAGMan should ignore the -usedagdir flag. (If you run the original DAG with -usedagdir, it fails and produces a rescue DAG, and then you re-submit the DAG with the same command-line arguments and DAGMan automatically runs the rescue DAG, the -usedagdir flag conflicts with the DIR specifications on the JOB lines, and the rescue DAG will never even run.)
remarks:
Hmm -- there's code in dagman_main.cpp that should do this -- I just need to check that it really works. wenger 2009-09-01.

Just verified that this works; here's a snippet from dagman.out: 

  02/05 18:22:18 RUNNING RESCUE DAG testdir/diamond.dag.rescue001
  02/05 18:22:18 Unsetting -useDagDir flag because we're running a rescue DAG

wenger 2010-02-05
check_ins: 2010-Feb-05 18:59   Check-in [25238]: Documented the new DAGMan NOOP job feature; also clarified the description of DONE; added a note that DIR, NOOP, and DONE must appear in that order; and noted that -usedagdir is now automatically disregarded when running a rescue DAG. (See gittrac #1078 and #533.) (By Kent Wenger )
